column4: am I going to seriously regret going from warty to hoary at this point in time, were I to do so?
you should regret. There's no point in making your computer unstable.
well.. i can burn audio-cds with warty. I did it yesterday with k3b. Although i started it as root from a gnome-terminal
Ok, then I will declare the k3b devs to be on crack :)  Can't you just chmod +s the k3b bin? (Insecure,  I know, but hey)
it sounds like a bug. I have several programs doing audio at once.
Hm, okay.  Just totem, maybe?  Can you try running rythmbox and totem at the same time and let me know if it works for you?
i can try. But rhythmbox is kind of slow on my computer, i have a very large archive of music. But wait a second.
Thank you :)
i can play music in both rhythmbox and totem at the same time.
hm.. weird.  The livecd crashed all over me when I tried.  Is there a newer livecd I can d/l?
dont know about that the livecd, cant you use partition magic to resize the ntfs?  I dont think there is a free program that does ntfs :(
I don't have a copy of that, and finding a store that sold something like that here would be impossible (I live in a small town.  Here, you buy software at Wal-Mart.)
*cough* get it from the internet,  i here its possible to download stuff for free  ;)
Ohhh.  lol

as for being able to run Ubuntu without problems,  for me i've never had a problem (though i never had any with Fedora either). If you can keep away from running unstable things, i dont see any reason to doubt the stability of Ubuntu.
Hmm, okay.  One other thing, are you running totem-gstreamer, or totem-xine?
totem-xine and the w32codecs (from universe).
Hm, okay.  Then I guess maybe the livecd just has old versions
I dont know if totem-gstreamer will use those codecs but i know totem-xine does. I never checked it becaus it was so easy to install totem-xine  :)
ubuntu comes with totem-gstreamer in default. I installed totem-xine after the installation.
i might be wrong but i think totem with the gstreamer backend is kind of buggy.
